title: If Noxus finds out Demacia has the World Runes
body: They will launch an immediate attack with full force. Imagine Ryze screws Demacia over.

replies.body:
There's a lot of nations between Noxus' most advanced borders, and Demacia. These guys can't just waltz on in and lay siege...

I mean, they could travel by sea... but they'd have to go through Piltover to avoid going around Shurima (and avoid passing Icathia) which would add months to the journey. And if Piltover was even slightly smart about keeping their stance neutral, they'd charge HUGE hazard rates for military vessels to pass through the Sun Gates, or just block them entirely. I mean, Noxus can't risk that relationship, if they want to maintain their foothold on the northern coast of Shurima!

It's almost like... you know, a REAL world, with consequences and very delicate political stalemates, which can be undone but then you have to face other consequences.

But sure, "my dad could beat up your dad", etc etc

{{sticker:garen-swing}} {{sticker:darius-angry}}

Honestly, wouldn't doing things the Hannibal Barca/Persian/Bismarckian way make more sense?  Offer the in-between kingdoms a spot in your army and a good portion of the loot to travel through their land.  With the unspoken threat that if they refuse you'll go to war with them.  Most weaker nations/cities historically take the offer to gain wealth while also making a valuable alliance with their stronger neighbor.  Integrate their armies into your own.  Then copiously reward them for their bravery to the point they actually want to fight alongside your legions as opposed to against you, unifying them under your banner or keeping them as a client kingdom/buffer state as needed.

Isn't...that what Noxus does anyways? Send to of their Legionnaires and say, "Join us." And then people join?

Don’t know haven’t read their lore. My understanding was that they more send their forces to conquer and then do so.

I’m talking about getting the between nations to your side by uniting them against a single enemy. Usually by playing to their sense of greed. 

Like in Demacia’s case, offering them a share of an extremely valuable resource that is exclusive to Demacia that is on all their buildings. You know, like Petricite. 

Join with Noxus, get Petricite and also our forces won’t rape and pillage your people. It’s a win for everyone.

For a prize as absolutely unimaginably valuable as a World Rune (assuming that they know what that is) they'd try SOMETHING. Probably a warmason to gather information on the runes, or an assassin/infiltrator of some sort. ~~Perhaps a fiery redhead who manages to sneak her way into the heart of a local Demacian hero so we can finally LET THE SHIP SET SA~~. Come to think of it, Noxus doesn't really have an assassin who operates primarily in the wild, someone comparable to Quinn... There's the implied rivalry with Talon, sure, but he's more of a parkour and cityscape assassin now...

And that's all assuming there's NO WAY for Noxus to launch an attack to obtain the Runes. Noxus seems to be getting close in the south, and we know from Quinn's color story that some scouts have reached out that far. They could potentially expand that way and send their forces overland, so long as Piltover/Zaun agree to stay neutral in the conflict. It'd be slow going to get to Demacia, but all of those problems with Piltover you just listed suddenly become DEMACIA'S problem instead.

The two nations are close enough to mutually consider each other rivals, which implies skirmishes in the past, and/or attempts at influence that the other screwed up (proxy engagements, something like the USSR vs USA during the cold war).

I mean, does Demacia even know that Demacia has the World Runes? Unless the vault is somehow tied to Kayle & Morgana (and Morgana is spiteful enough to tell the Noxians where the World Runes are), I don't see the Noxians having any idea where the World Runes are located.

Note: For those wondering why I brought up Kayle & Morgana, they are listed as Demacian Champions (more specifically, they originate, geographically, from the area in which modern Demacia is located) on the new map of Runeterra.
